messages.content: Kaytlin, I'm sorry to hear that you had such a tough day. What exactly happened?
Well, my teacher was mad at me for not doing my homework and I got a zero on my quiz.
That does sound like a tough day. I'm sure your teacher was just trying to help you by giving you that low grade.
Yeah, I guess so. But it still feels terrible.
Of course it does. Kaytlin, do you want to talk about it more? I'm here for you and I want to help however I can.
Hi Kitana, how are you feeling?
Not great. My finger really hurts.
I'm so sorry. Here, let me get you an ice pack.
Thank you, Gentry. You're always so kind.
It's the least I could do. How did this happen?
I was chopping vegetables and the knife slipped.
That sounds like it hurt! Is there anything I can do to help you feel better?
Just sitting here with me is helping a lot, thank you.
I'm happy to do it. Do you want to talk about anything?
Not really. I just feel kind of down, you know?
Yeah, I can understand that. It's tough when we get hurt unexpectedly.
Yeah. I just hate feeling like this.
I know how you feel. But ice is going to help a lot and before you know it, you'll be feeling better again.
Thanks, Gentry.
Hey, it looks like you're getting pretty nervous about your upcoming test.
Yeah, I am. I'm just worried that I'm not going to do well.
Well, don't worry. I know you can do it. You're a smart person and you've been studying hard. I believe in you.
Thank you, Terrin. Just hearing you say that makes me feel a little better.
Of course! I'm always here for you if you need to talk or want some encouragement.
Thanks, Terrin. I really appreciate it.
Hi Lael, how are you doing?
I'm feeling kind of angry right now. Just seeing all this mess around me makes me so mad.
I can understand why you might be feeling that way. It's really tough when things are such a mess and we don't know how to fix them.
Yeah, I just feel like everything is falling apart and I can't do anything about it. It's just so frustrating.

Yeah, I know how you feel. But sometimes when we're feeling like that, it helps to talk to someone who understands and can help us see things in a different light. Would you like to talk about what's going on?
Yeah, I think that would help. Thanks, Esabella.
Of course. So, what's been going on that's been making you so angry?
Javin, I was wondering if you might want to help me with something.
Sure, what is it?
Well, I was thinking that maybe if you helped me with something, you would feel better about yourself and not so left out.
What do you need help with?
I don't know, anything really. Just something to make you feel useful.
Okay, I'll help you with whatever you need.
So, how are you feeling today?
I'm feeling better, thanks for asking.
That's good to hear. How's your head?
It's a little better. The pain isn't as bad as it was before.
That's good. I'm glad the pain is subsiding. Are you still having any trouble with your vision?
No, my vision is fine now. The doctors said that my injuries weren't too severe and that I should make a full recovery.
That's great news! I'm so relieved to hear that.
Me too. I was really worried that I might not be able to see again.
I know. But like they say, everything happens for a reason. And I'm sure there's a reason why you were spared.
Yeah, I guess so.
So, what do you think the future holds for you?
I'm not sure. I'm just taking things one day at a time right now.
That's understandable. It's probably going to take some time for you to adjust to everything that's happened.
Yeah, it definitely has been a lot to deal with.
Well, if there's anything I can do to help, please don't hesitate to let me know.
Thanks, Amada. I appreciate it.
I'm sorry your day was so tough. I hope tomorrow is better.
Thanks, Nakiya. It was just one of those days where everything went wrong. I really appreciate your understanding.
Of course, Kollin. I know how it feels to have a day like that. Just know that I'm here for you if you need to talk or vent about anything.
Thank you, Nakiya. Your support means a lot to me.
Hi, Auston. I'm so sorry to hear about what happened.
Thank you, Monserrath. I appreciate your support.
Of course. I just wish there was more that I could do to help you feel better.
Just knowing that you're here for me makes a big difference. Thank you.
Anytime, Auston. I'm always here for you.
It's just so hard to believe that something like this could happen. I feel like I'm in a nightmare.
I know, it's tough to process. But you're not alone, we're all here for you.
I'm here for you, Kynslee.
Thank you, Kensleigh. I appreciate it.
You're going through a tough time right now. But I want you to know that I'm here for you and that everything will be alright.
Thank you, Kensleigh. That means a lot to me.
I know you're feeling lost right now, but you're not alone. I'm here for you, Kynslee.
Thank you, Kensleigh. I appreciate your support.
Hey, it's okay. I'm here for you.
I just feel so alone right now.
You're not alone. I'm here with you.
But everyone else is gone.
They're not gone forever. They'll be back soon enough. Just hang in there, okay?
I don't know if I can do this by myself.
You don't have to do it by yourself. I'm here with you, remember? We'll get through this together, okay?
Hey, Tamira. What's up? You seem upset.
I'm just having a bad day.
That's too bad. I'm sorry to hear that. What happened?
Well, my mom and dad got into a big fight this morning and it really upset me. Then my best friend called me and she was mad at me for something I didn't even do. It's just been a really lousy day.
Oh, no! I'm so sorry to hear that, Tamira. It sounds like it's been rough today. Do you want to talk about it? I'm here for you if you need to vent or anything.
Thanks, Kortni. Just talking about it is helping already. It feels good to know someone cares and is willing to listen."
Hey, Sione. I wanted to talk to you about something.
What's up?
I know you've been going through a tough time lately, and I just wanted to tell you that I'm here for you. I care about you and I want to help you in any way I can.
Thank you, Lochlan. It means a lot to me to hear that. I appreciate your support.
Of course! Anytime, my friend. If there's ever anything you need, don't hesitate to let me know, okay?
Alright, thank you.
No problem. I just want to see you happy and healthy, that's all.
I appreciate that.
Hey, Lindy. I noticed that you were afraid of cats when you saw that stray cat on the sidewalk. I decided to make you feel better by buying you a toy cat.
Thank you so much, Maximillian! I really appreciate it.
No problem at all. I just wanted to make sure that you felt comfortable around cats.
Well, thank you again. This really means a lot to me.
Hi Amelie! I'm so glad to see you. How are you doing?
I'm doing okay, thanks for asking. It's been tough lately, but I'm hanging in there.
I'm sorry to hear that. What's been going on?
Well, my mom has been really sick and it's been hard to watch her suffer. And on top of that, my job has been really stressful lately. But like I said, I'm hanging in there.

That sounds tough. I can't even imagine how you're feeling. But it sounds like you're a lot stronger than you give yourself credit for. You're handling all of this so well considering everything that's going on.
Thanks, Shannon. Just knowing that you're here for me makes me feel a little better already.
Of course, I'm always here for you. You can talk to me anytime about anything, you know that.
I know, and I appreciate it. Just talking to you makes me feel better already. Thanks for being here for me.
Hey Esau, I noticed that you seem to be hanging out by yourself a lot lately. Is everything okay?
Yeah, I'm fine. I just don't have anyone to hang out with.
That sucks. I know how you feel. I was in the same situation when I first came here. But then I met some friends and we started hanging out all the time.
It's not that easy for me. I don't know anyone here.
Well, why don't you come hang out with us? We're always doing something fun. And it would be great to have another person to hang out with.
Yeah, that sounds good. Thanks, Enya!
Hey James, how's it going?
Not great. I'm really struggling today.
Why, what's up?
I don't know, everything just feels really hard right now. I just feel like I can't do anything right.

Hey, it's okay. I'm sure you're doing fine. Sometimes we all have off days where everything feels a little harder than usual. It doesn't mean that you're not doing well, it's just a day where things are a bit tougher.
Yeah, I guess you're right. Thanks for understanding Jamison.
Of course! Any time you need to talk, don't hesitate to come to me okay? We can chat about whatever is on your mind.
Alright, thanks Jamison.
Hey, what's wrong?
Just feeling a little down today.
I'm sorry to hear that. What's going on?
Just some stuff with my family. It's been tough lately.
I know how that feels. My family can be tough to deal with too sometimes. But I'm here for you if you need to talk about it.
Thanks, Sherman. Just knowing you're here for me makes me feel a little better already.
Of course, anytime. So, what's been going on?
Well, my mom and dad have been fighting a lot lately. And it's really been stressing me out.
Yeah, I can imagine. That would be tough to deal with.
It is. I don't know what to do or how to make it stop.
Well, maybe we can brainstorm some ideas together and see if we can come up with something that might help.
Yeah, that would be great. Thanks, Sherman.
Hi, Amber. How are you doing?
I'm alright. Just a little bit stressed out.
Yeah, I can imagine. What's going on?
Well, my parents are getting divorced and it's just really hard to see them fight all the time. Plus, I'm worried about how it's going to affect my brother and me. We're both really close to our dad.
That sounds tough. But you know, things will eventually get better. You're strong and you'll get through this. Plus, you always have me here for you. I'll help you through anything that comes up.
Thanks, Antionette. Just talking to you makes me feel a lot better already.
Hi, Willy. You look worried. What's wrong?
I'm failing math.
That's not good. But don't worry, you can get a tutor to help you raise your grades.
I don't know if that will be enough. My parents are going to be so disappointed in me.
They won't be disappointed in you, they'll just be happy that you're trying to improve your grades.
I guess you're right. Thanks for talking to me, Vann.
No problem, Willy. Anytime you need to talk, just let me know.
I'm so sorry to hear about your breakup, Safia. I know how much you loved her.
Yeah, I did. I really thought we were going to make it work.
It's hard when things don't work out the way we want them too. But you're still an amazing person and I love you no matter what.
Thank you, Deklan. That means a lot to me coming from you.
Of course! I just want you to know that I'm here for you and I care about you.
Thanks, man. I appreciate it.
Hey, are you okay? You look really down.
Yeah, I'm just feeling kind of low lately.
That's understandable. life has been pretty tough lately. But it's always nice to talk to a friend about it. Let me make you some tea and we can chat.
Thanks, Kailyn. That sounds really nice.
So, what's been going on that's got you feeling so down?
Well, my mom has been really stressed out lately and she's been taking it out on me a lot. And then my boss was just giving me a hard time at work and I'm just feeling kind of overwhelmed right now.
Yeah, I can definitely understand that. It sounds like you've had a really tough week. Do you want to talk about it more? I'm here for you if you need to vent or anything.
Hi, Paulo. I'm really sorry to hear about what happened at school.
Yeah, it was pretty awful.
I can't believe that people would be so mean to you. You don't deserve that.
Thank you, Jakeem. It really means a lot to me that you care.
Of course I care! We're friends, right? And friends stick together no matter what.
Yeah, I guess you're right. Thanks for being my friend, Jakeem.
Hi, Mollie. I'm so glad you decided to come talk to me today.
Hi, Daylan. Thanks for talking with me. I've been feeling really down lately and could use a friend.
I'm sorry to hear that you're feeling down. What's been going on?
Everything just seems so hard right now. I don't know if I can do this anymore.

I completely understand how you feel. It sounds like you're going through a tough time right now. But I want you to know that I believe in you and I know that you can get through this. You're strong and capable of anything you set your mind to. Just keep moving forward one step at a time and things will start getting better, I promise. Do you have any other friends or family members you can talk to about how you're feeling? It might help to get some support from them as well
Hey, Evie. You okay?
Yeah, I'm fine. Just a little upset about something.
Well, if you want to talk about it, I'm here to listen. I know how good it feels when someone helps you when you're upset.
It's just that my best friend moved away and I'm really going to miss her. We used to do everything together and now she's gone.
That sounds really tough. How long ago did she move away?
A few weeks ago. But it feels like forever.

Have you tried staying in touch with her? You can still talk to her even if she's not right there in front of you. And maybe someday she'll move back or you can visit her. Friendships can last a long time, even when people are far apart.
You're right. I should try to stay in touch with her. And I will visit her. Thanks for talking to me, Jazlynn. It really helped.
Anytime, Evie.
Hi, Beautiful. I want to give you a hug.
Why?
Because I care about you and I want to make you feel better.
I don't need a hug.
Please, just let me give you a hug.
No, Adalyne. I don't want a hug from you.
Hi Diamante, how are you doing?
I'm doing alright, thank you. Just taking things one day at a time.
That's good. If there's anything I can do to help you feel better, just let me know.
Thanks, Blayze. Just having you here is a big help.
Hey, you forgot to take your medicine again.
I'm sorry. I just forgot.
It's not a big deal, but you need to make sure you take it every day. Otherwise, you're not going to feel better.
I know. I'm sorry. I'll try to remember from now on.
The important thing is that you're taking it now. Drink lots of water with it and you'll start feeling better in no time.
Ori, I noticed you were cold, so I got this jacket for you. I want you to feel better.
Thank you, Kailen. I appreciate your concern.
It's no problem. I care about you and want you to be comfortable.
You're a good friend.
I try to be. So, how are you feeling?
I'm feeling better, thanks to you.
Hey Tim, how's your day going?
It's been alright. I'm just really tired today.
Yeah, I can imagine. You look like you could use a coffee or something.
Yeah, that would be great. Thanks, Lovell.
No problem. So what's been going on lately? Anything exciting?
Not really. Just the usual stuff. Work, home, sleep. Rinse and repeat.
Yeah, I know how that is. But you can't let life pass you by. You've got to live a little.
I guess you're right. It's just hard to find the motivation sometimes.
Well, maybe I can help with that. I'll tell you what, tomorrow we're going to go on an adventure. Just you and me. And it's going to be so much fun, you won't even know what hit you!
Lovell, that sounds great! I'm actually looking forward to it already!
Kolin, you don't look so good. Are you feeling okay?
Yeah, I'm just a little tired. I didn't sleep well last night.
Maybe you should lie down and rest for a bit. You might feel better if you do.
Yeah, that's probably a good idea. Thanks, Misty.

No problem, Kolin. I just want to make sure you're feeling better.
Kolin, how are you feeling?
I'm feeling a little better, thanks.
That's good. Just take it easy and rest for now. I'll check on you later.
I'm sorry to hear about your break-up, Donte.
Yeah, it sucks. I really thought she was the one.
I know how you feel. My last relationship ended for similar reasons.
Really? What happened?
Well, it turns out she was cheating on me. With my best friend, no less.
That's terrible! I'm so sorry.
Thanks. It was a tough time, but I got through it. And if there's anything I can do to help you through this, just let me know.
Hi Nathaneal! I'm going to give you a makeover today.
Oh, okay. I trust you.
Great! Let's start with your hair. I'm going to do a style you've never tried before.
Okay, sounds good.
First, I'm going to brush it out and then I'll start doing the new style.
All right.
So, how do you like the new style?
It's different, but I like it!
I'm sorry that I was so rude to you, Delani. I didn't mean to hurt your feelings.
It's okay, Willis. I know you didn't mean it. I'm just really sensitive right now.
I can tell. I can see how upset you are. Can I give you a hug?
No, I don't think that's a good idea.
Why not? I just want to show you that I care about you and I'm sorry for what happened.
I appreciate the offer, Willis, but I really don't want to be hugged right now. Maybe another time.
Okay, Delani. If that's what you want. I'm here for you if you need anything.
Hey, what's up? You seem a little down lately.
Yeah, I've just been feeling kind of out of place lately. Like everyone else knows what they're doing and I'm just flailing around.
I know how you feel. I sometimes feel like an outsider too. It's okay to not be perfect all the time. We all have our moments where we feel like we don't belong.
Thank you for understanding, Dade. It really means a lot to me. Just knowing that someone else feels the same way makes me feel a little better.
Hey, I've been meaning to stop by and check on you. How are you feeling?
I'm feeling better, thanks for asking. It's been a tough few weeks, but I'm finally starting to feel like myself again.
That's great! I was worried about you. You had me really worried for a while there.
Sorry about that. I know I shouldn't have let things get so out of hand, but it all happened so quickly.
It's okay, we all make mistakes. The important thing is that you're on the road to recovery now. So how's your physical therapy going?
It's going well. My therapist says that I'm making good progress and should be back to normal soon enough.
That's great news! I'm sure your family is relieved too.
Yes, they are. But to be honest, they were never really that worried about me in the first place.
Really? Why not?
They know how strong I am and they knew that I would pull through no matter what happened
Hey, you okay?
Yeah, I'm fine. Just a little thirsty.
Here, let me get you some water.
Thanks.
No problem. So, how are you doing? Really?
I don't know. It's just all so overwhelming right now. I feel like I'm barely holding on most days.
That sounds tough. I wish there was something I could do to make it better for you.
Just knowing that you're here for me makes a difference. Sometimes I feel so alone and lost, but knowing that you're in my corner makes me feel a little bit better.
I'm so sorry, Tayler. I wish I could take away all your pain.
It's not your fault. There's nothing you can do.
I know, but I still want to help. Is there anything I can do?
Just being here is enough. Knowing that you care makes me feel a little better.
Good. I'm glad I can be here for you. If you ever need to talk, or just need someone to be with, don't hesitate to call me, okay?
Thank you, Domonick. That means a lot to me.
Hey Cage, I couldn't help but notice that you looked like you were having a tough day. I just wanted to buy you dinner and talk for a bit if that's okay?
Yeah, that would be great. Thank you.
So what happened?
I was arguing with my boss and it just wasn't going well. I don't know what I did wrong but he was really mad at me.
That sounds rough. I'm sure it wasn't anything you did on purpose though. bosses can be tough to please sometimes.
Yeah, I guess so. It's just hard because I really need this job and I don't want to screw things up.
Well, maybe there's something you can do to make things better with your boss? Have you tried talking to him about it?
No, not yet. But maybe that's a good idea. Thanks for the advice, Jakayla.
Of course! Anytime! Let me know how it goes with your boss, okay?
Hey, Idalis. I just wanted to check on you and see how you're doing.
I'm alright, Alexia. Thanks for changing my sheets, it really meant a lot.
Yeah, no problem. I just wanted to do something nice for you since you've been going through a tough time lately.
Thank you. It's really appreciated.
Is there anything else I can do for you? Anything at all?
Nope, I think you've done enough already. But thank you so much, Alexia. You're a true friend.
I'm sorry to hear about your parents getting a divorce, Liza. I know it's tough to go through something like that.
Yeah, it really sucks. I don't understand why they can't just work things out.
Well, sometimes people just grow apart and decide that it's best to go their separate ways. But even though they're not together anymore, that doesn't mean they don't still love you.
I guess that makes sense. It's just hard to accept that my family is changing like this.

I know how you feel. My parents got divorced when I was younger too. It was really tough for a while, but eventually I realized that they were both still great parents even though they weren't together anymore. And I'm sure your parents will still be great parents too, even if they're not together anymore.
Thanks for understanding, Nariah. It means a lot to me.
Hey, it's been a while since we've talked. How are you doing?
I'm doing alright. Just been really busy lately.
Yeah, I can imagine. So, what's been going on?
Well, I've just been really stressed out with school and work and everything else. It feels like I can't ever catch a break.
That sounds tough. I'm here for you though, you know that right? You can always come to me for anything you need.
Thanks, Paizlee. It means a lot to me knowing that I have you in my corner. Sometimes it feels like everyone else is against me.

Don't say that. I'm sure there are people who care about you and want to help you through this tough time. But even if there aren't, I'm here for you no matter what happens. You're not alone in this, okay?
You seem like you've been through a lot lately. What's going on?
It's been tough, that's for sure. I don't really know where to begin.
Take your time. I'm here for you.
Well, my parents got divorced recently and it's just been really hard to deal with. I feel like I'm stuck in the middle of everything and I don't know what to do.
That sounds really tough. Have you talked to anyone else about it?
Yeah, I've talked to my friends and family but it just doesn't seem like enough. It feels like nobody really understands what I'm going through.

I can understand how that would feel but sometimes talking to someone who isn't as close to the situation can be helpful because they can offer a different perspective. What do you think about talking to me about it? Would that be something you would be interested in?
Yeah, I think that would be really helpful. Thank you for offering.
Of course, anytime. So, where would you like to start?
Hey, are you doing okay? You seem really down lately.
Yeah, I'm just struggling a lot right now. Everything seems so hard.
I'm sorry to hear that. I wish I could do something to help.
Just knowing that you care means a lot. Thank you.
Of course, I care about you a lot. So, what's been going on that's been so tough?

Well, my parents are getting divorced and it's just really hard to see them both so unhappy. They're always fighting and it feels like my home is falling apart. Plus, school has been really tough too. I'm just failing all my classes and I don't know what to do anymore.

That sounds really tough. I can't even imagine how you must be feeling right now. It's totally normal for things to feel overwhelming when we're going through something tough like this. Have you talked to anyone else about how you're feeling? A therapist or anyone?

No, I haven't really talked to anyone about it because it feels like no one would understand anyway. And honestly, therapy seems like such a waste of time and money when nothing is ever going to change anyway.

Saniyah, things might not seem like they'll ever get better right now, but trust me, they will eventually get better with time heals all wounds type thing). It doesn't mean that your pain isn't valid or that what you're feeling doesn't matter though."
All right, let's see. What do you think of this dress?
It's pretty.
You think so? I was thinking maybe it was a little too flashy.
Maybe for you, but I like it.
Well, if you like it then that's all that matters. Let me help you put it on.
Okay.
There, now let's take a look at your hair. Have you brushed it today?
Yes, I did it this morning before breakfast.
All right, good. We don't want to have to deal with any tangles now do we? Let me just fix up your part a little bit and then we'll be all set. There, now doesn't that look much better?
Yeah, thanks Evander.
Hey, Khaliah. I saw what happened with that dog earlier. Are you okay?
Yeah, I'm fine. I was just a little scared at first, that's all.
Well, there's no need to be afraid of dogs. They're usually very friendly creatures.
That's what my mom said too. She also said that if I ever see a dog on the street again, I should just ask the owner if it's okay to pet the dog.
That's a good idea. You never know, some people might not want their dogs to be touched by strangers.
Exactly. Thanks for talking to me about this, Wilbert. It really helped put my mind at ease.
How are you feeling today, Farhan?
Not great. I've been feeling really ill for the past few days.
I'm so sorry to hear that. What can I do to help you feel better?
Honestly, just having you here with me makes me feel a lot better. Just knowing that you care about me and want to help is a huge help in itself. Thank you, Emery.
Of course, Farhan. I care about you a lot and want to see you feeling better as soon as possible.
I appreciate that. Just having you here with me makes me feel a lot better.
So what's been going on?
Just work stuff. It's been frustrating lately.
What happened?
I don't know. It just seems like everything I do is wrong. My boss is always yelling at me and today he told me I was lucky he didn't fire me.
That sounds rough. I'm sorry.
Yeah, it sucks. I've been trying to figure out what I'm doing wrong, but I can't seem to figure it out.
Have you talked to anyone about it?
No, not really. I don't want to bother anyone with my problems.
Well, maybe you should talk to someone about it. It might help you figure out what's going on and how to fix it.
Yeah, maybe you're right. Thanks for listening, Yakov. It means a lot
Hey, are you okay? You look upset.
Yeah, I'm fine. Just a little worried about you.
Why? I'm perfectly fine.
You've been through a lot lately and I just want to make sure you're really okay.
I appreciate your concern, but there's really no need to worry about me. I'm a big girl and I can handle myself. Besides, what's the worst that could happen?
Well, I don't know. That's why I'm worried.
Tymir, seriously, stop worrying about me. Everything is going to be fine, I promise.
I hope so. I just can't help but worry about you.
I know, and I appreciate it. But please, try not to worry so much. Okay?
Okay. I'll try.
Hey, Tzipora. You okay?
Yeah, I'm fine. Just a little overwhelmed, I guess.
It's a lot to take in, for sure. But you're doing great. Just keep taking it one step at a time.
Thanks, Tanesha. That means a lot coming from you.
Of course! Anytime you need to talk, I'm here for you. We're in this together, remember?
Yeah. I guess it just feels like everything is happening so fast.
I know. But we'll get through it, together. Just lean on me when you need to, okay?
Okay. Thanks, Tanesha.
So, how's your day been?
It's been all right. I've just been feeling a bit down lately.
I'm sorry to hear that. What's been going on?
Just some stuff at work and with my family. Nothing too serious, but it's just been weighing on me.
I completely understand. It sounds like you could use a pick-me-up.
Yeah, maybe I could use a break from everything.
Well, how about we have dinner together? I'll make your favorite meal and we can catch up on what's been going on in our lives. Sound good?
That actually sounds really great. Thank you, Odin.
Don't mention it! Now, what would you like for dinner?
Hey, Aliyah. I know you're feeling pretty down about what's going on right now. But I want you to know that it's not as bad as it seems. There are ways to fix this situation.
Really? What can I do? I feel like I'm just spinning my wheels and getting nowhere.

Well, first of all, you need to relax and take a deep breath. This is not the end of the world. We'll figure something out together, okay? Secondly, have you talked to your parents about what's going on? They might be able to help you out or give you some advice.
That's a good idea. I didn't even think of that. Thanks, Danny. Just talking to you has made me feel a lot better already.
That's what friends are for. So, what do you say we take a break from studying and go get some coffee?
Sounds great! Thanks again, Danny.
I'm so sorry about what happened, Vivien. I know how much you loved your cat.
Yeah, I don't think I've ever been so attached to an animal before. It's just really hard losing her.
Well, I want to make you feel better. What's your favorite meal? I'll cook it for you, and then we can go buy you a present to cheer you up.
That sounds really nice of you, Samone. Thank you.
It's no problem at all. So what's your favorite meal?
Hmm, that's tough to decide. I love Italian food, but my mom makes the best Mexican food ever.
Okay, how about we do a combination of both? We'll have spaghetti with tacos on the side!
That actually sounds really good! And thank you again for being so understanding and supportive. It means a lot to me right now.
Hey Karol, I noticed you have a scar on your leg. What happened?
Oh, I got it when I was younger. I was playing with my friends and we were climbing a tree. I fell out and landed on a rock. It was pretty bad.
Oh no! That sounds really painful. Did you have to go to the hospital?
Yeah, I did. I had to get stitches. It wasn't too bad though.
That's good. Do you still have the scar?
Yeah, I do. It's not too big though.
That's good. Well, if you ever need to talk about it or anything, I'm here for you okay?
Thanks Anora!
Hi, Katelin. You look sad. What's wrong?
Oh, it's nothing. I'm just a little tired, I guess.
Well, how about I sing you a lullaby? It always makes me feel better when I'm feeling down.
Okay.
This lullaby is about a mother bird tucking her baby bird in for the night. The baby bird always knows that its mother will be there when it wakes up in the morning.
That's really sweet, Zaine.
I hope it makes you feel better.
It does. Thank you.
You're welcome. Sweet dreams, Katelin.
I'm so sorry about what happened, Ena. I know how much your reputation means to you.
It's not your fault, Zaara. I should have been more careful.
I feel like I need to do something to make you feel better. Can I buy you a gift?
That's very sweet of you, but it's not necessary.
Please, let me do this for you. It would make me feel better if I could help in some way.
All right, thank you. That's very kind of you.
Hi, Brenton. How are you feeling?
Not so great. My throat hurts and I don't feel like doing anything.
I'm sorry to hear that. Do you want me to tuck you in?
Yes, please.
Okay, let's get you into bed. (After tucking Brenton in) There you go. Is there anything else I can do for you?
No, I think that's it for now. Thanks, Ravyn.
You're welcome. I'll stay here with you until you fall asleep, if that's okay with you?
Yeah, that would be nice. Thanks again.
Of course. (After a few minutes) Are you feeling any better?
Yeah, I think so. The pain isn't as bad and I'm starting to feel sleepy.
That's good. I'll stay here until you're asleep, then.
Thanks, Ravyn.
I know it wasn't easy for you, and I'm sorry that I couldn't be there more for you.
It's okay, I know you were busy with your own stuff. I just wish I could have handled it better.
What do you mean?
I don't know, I just feel like I should have been stronger. Like I could have prevented it from happening if only I was better.
Lizabeth, you can't blame yourself for what happened. It wasn't your fault.
But if only I was stronger, maybe things would have been different.
You're strong enough, Lizabeth. And even if you weren't, it wouldn't have changed what happened. So please stop beating yourself up about it.
I guess you're right. It's just hard to accept that I couldn't do anything to change it.
I know, but you have to try. For your own sake.
Yeah, I know. Thanks for understanding, Jemima.
Of course, anytime. That's what friends are for.
Hi, Arianny. How are you feeling today?
I'm feeling a bit better, thank you.
That's good to hear. Can I get you anything?
No, I'm fine, thank you.
Are you sure? You look a bit pale.
I'm sure. I appreciate your concern though.
Of course. Let me know if you need anything, okay?
I will, thank you.
Zari, I'm so sorry. I can't imagine how you must be feeling right now.
It's just all so sudden. One minute she was there and the next she was gone. I keep expecting her to walk through the door any minute now.
I know, it's hard to believe that she's really gone. But she is in a better place now, free from pain and suffering.
That's what everyone keeps telling me but it doesn't make this hurt any less.
I know, sweetie. It will take time but eventually the pain will start to fade and you'll be able to remember all the good times you shared with her without feeling so much sadness.
Thank you, Noah. Just being here with you is helping me feel a little better already.
Hey, let me see that.
It's nothing, I'm fine.
No, seriously, let me see it.
Fine.
That stuff is amazing. What is it?
It's a balm my mom used to make for me when I was younger. She always swore by its healing properties.
Well, it seems to be working wonders on you already. Let me have some of that.
Here, take the whole tin. I don't need it anymore.
Thanks, man. I really appreciate it.
No problem, just be careful with it. It's the only tin I have left.
I will, don't worry. Hey, do you want to get some coffee or something?
Sure, that sounds great.
Makaela, it's okay. You're brave and you can overcome your fears.
But I'm so scared. I don't know if I can do it.
Yes, you can. I believe in you. You're strong and capable. You can do this.
But what if I fail?

Then you get back up and try again. That's the beauty of life. It's always moving forward, giving us new chances to succeed. So don't be afraid to take risks and to stumble along the way. Because that's how we learn and grow as individuals.
Thank you, Jacquez. Just talking to you has made me feel better. I think I can do this now.
I know you can. You're going to be great.
Anakaren, it's okay. I'm here for you.
I don't deserve your kindness. I've been nothing but a burden to you.
That's not true. You're going through a tough time right now. I understand how you feel.
I just wish I could make everything go away.
Anakaren, look at me. Everything will be alright, I promise. Just take a deep breath and try to relax.
Corinne, I...
Shhh, it's okay. I'm here for you.
Hey, it looks like you're having a tough day.
Yeah, I just can't seem to get out of this funk.
Well, one thing that always makes me feel better is taking a walk in the park. Maybe the fresh air will do you some good too.
That sounds like a good idea. I think I'll give it a try.
Great! Let me know how it goes.
I went to the park like you suggested, and it actually did make me feel a little better. Just being out in nature and getting some exercise was refreshing. Thanks for the advice, Deonte.
You're welcome, Sarahy. I'm glad it helped!
I'm glad you're feeling more comfortable.
Yeah, your clothes are way more comfortable than mine. Thanks for letting me borrow them.
No problem. I know how uncomfortable it can be to wear clothes that don't fit right.
Yeah, my jeans were really tight and uncomfortable. But these ones feel much better.
I'm glad I could help out. And hopefully now you'll be able to focus more on the conversation and less on how uncomfortable you are.
Thank you, Kiandra. I appreciate your understanding and support.
Of course, Natalia. I care about you and want you to feel comfortable around me.
I do feel more comfortable now. Thanks again.
You're welcome. Now, what were you saying before?
Hey, it's okay. I'm here for you.
I'm just really scared right now.
I know, but I'm here with you. We'll get through this together.
Thank you, Krishna. I appreciate your support.
Of course, anything for my best friend. So, what do you say we try to take our minds off of things for a little while? Maybe watch a movie or something?
Yeah, that sounds good.
Hey, buddy. You okay?
Yeah, I'm fine. Just feeling a little down today.

That's understandable. It's been a tough week for you. First, your mom gets sick and then your dog runs away. But you know what? I'm here for you and I'll always be here for you. So don't worry, okay?
Thanks, Terrance. That means a lot to me.
Of course, man. What are friends for? Now let's go get some ice cream and forget about all this sadness for awhile, huh?
Sounds great!
Hey, Hyrum. You seem like you're having a tough day.
Yeah, I'm just feeling really overwhelmed with everything right now.
I completely understand. It can be really tough trying to juggle everything. But you're not alone. I'm here for you and I want to help in any way I can.
Thank you, Dorothea. Just knowing that I have someone to talk to who understands makes me feel a little better already.
Of course! That's what friends are for. So let's talk about what's going on and see if we can figure out a plan to make things more manageable for you.
Okay.
So, what's been the most stressful part of your day?
Hey Anwar, what's up?
Just feeling a little down today.
Aww, I'm sorry to hear that. Here, have a carrot.
Thanks, Davion. It's really nice of you to try and cheer me up.
Hey, that's what friends are for! So, what's been bothering you?
I don't know, just everything I guess. School has been stressful lately and I'm not sure what I want to do with my life after graduation.
Yeah, I know how you feel. School can be tough sometimes. But as for your future plans, have you given any thought to what you might want to do?
Not really. I've been thinking about becoming a teacher or maybe working in environmental science. But I don't know if either of those are the right fit for me.
Well, those both sound like great options! Have you talked to anyone else about your concerns?
Just my parents and they're not really helping much since they don't understand what I'm going through right now.
Well, maybe we can brainstorm a bit and see if we can come up with some ideas together? Would that help at all?
Hey, I saw what happened with you and Jake. I'm so sorry.
Thanks, Teaira. It sucks. I can't believe he would do that to me.
I know, it's really tough when something like that happens. But you'll get through it, I promise.
I don't know if I can. He was everything to me.
Thor, listen to me. You are strong and beautiful and smart and you will find someone who appreciates all of those things about you. Jake is an idiot for not seeing how amazing you are.
Thank you, Teaira. Just hearing you say that makes me feel a little better.
Good! Now let's forget about him and have some fun tonight, okay? Here, drink this and let's dance!
So, how are you feeling?
I'm feeling better, thanks. The pill you gave me seems to be helping.
That's good. I'm glad it's helping.
Yeah, me too. It was starting to get pretty overwhelming there for a while.
I can imagine. It sounds like you've been through a lot lately.
Yeah, I have. It's been tough, but I'm trying to stay positive and keep moving forward.
That's definitely the right attitude to have. things will get better with time, just keep pushing through and don't give up on yourself.
Thank you, Karan. That means a lot coming from you
